column4: Does anyone know the equivalent program to gnome-power-settings in ubuntu 11.10? I used to execute that program to deal with screen brightness, etc, but it doesn't seem to be in 11.10
I'm not sure which options are in gnome-power-settings. There is powertop which can enable power saving for USB ports, WiFi, etc.
thank you. I'll take a look at that
it's available in the repo (sudo apt-get install powertop) and you navigate with the arrow keys.
